page.title: 15THE VILLAGE HALL HENFIELD.
page.content: The Village Hall was finished in 1974. It replaced the Old Assembly Rooms. These are now shops. It is off the High Street and has its own car park. It has a stage, a small hall, committee room, kitchen and houses the Parish Council Office and Museum. The Village Hall is very important and handy because you can hire it for all kinds of things. The W. I. go there for meetings. At Christmas people give parties and perform pantomimes. I go there for gymnastics and we have a good time. The B. P. Guild meet here. Ballet and Judo classes are held. It can be used for receptions. All sorts of Clubs use the Hall including the Badminton and Flower Group. I think it is a very useful and good place. It is the centre of our entertainments.
